author: odinair
install_msg:
**This cog requires a running statsd daemon to use.**

If you have no idea what that means, you're likely trying to use the wrong cog.

(are you looking for a statistics command? if so, you may be looking for my `misctools` cog's `statistics` toolset instead.)
short: Send statistics about your Red bot to a statsd daemon
description:
This cog requires a statsd daemon to be running on your host machine, or the host to be configured with '[p]botstats host'.

If you have no idea what any of that means, this likely isn't the cog you're looking for.

This cog has only been tested with netdata (https://github.com/netdata/netdata), but it should work with any statsd server that correctly handles gauges and counters.

The following data is collected and sent to statsd:

- Current ping in milliseconds
- # of servers
- # of unique users across all servers
- # of text & voice channels in all servers
- The amount of people currently listening to music
- Counters of messages received and commands processed
